meanings.definition: To put (liquid) into a new bottle.
meanings.sent1: She rebottles the juice to keep it fresh.
meanings.sent2: After buying a new bottle, she rebottles the water for convenience.
meanings.sent3: He rebottles the soda, pretending to be a magician with potions.
meanings.sent4: The act of rebottling the perfume transforms it into a new experience.
meanings.sent5: The way she rebottles the honey makes it look like a science experiment.

meanings.sent1: Mom rebottles the milk into a smaller container for the trip.
meanings.sent2: He rebottles the oil into a glass jar for easier pouring.

meanings.sent4: The idea of rebottling the tea symbolizes a fresh start.
meanings.sent5: The way she rebottles the vinegar makes it seem like a secret recipe.
